body_html:
Actually, are you saying that unpacking (25000,10) is so much faster than unpacking (25000,320) that it plays a role in this case? I compared the unpacking times on both shapes when no backward pass is involved and it is almost the same.

From my understanding, the GRU and dense layers do the same amount of computation on tensors of the same shape. Consequently, the speed difference should come from the packing functions. I put it into a table to highlight the flow. Perhaps this could be a recommended workflow until packing/unpacking speed is improved.

body:
Actually, are you saying that unpacking (25000,10) is so much faster than unpacking (25000,320) that it plays a role in this case? I compared the unpacking times on both shapes when no backward pass is involved and it is almost the same.

From my understanding, the GRU and dense layers do the same amount of computation on tensors of the same shape. Consequently, the speed difference should come from the packing functions. I put it into a table to highlight the flow. Perhaps this could be a recommended workflow until packing/unpacking speed is improved.

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/13469638/27330956-bf1bd154-55bb-11e7-8f7c-ad4e48667a69.png)
